trigger: Air raid sirens echo in the distance...
cannot_enter_shelter: A vague feeling of neglect washes over you.
It keeps you from stepping into the shelter.
enter_shelter: You huddle inside the shelter, trembling...

delivery: Thank you! My dad hasn't been doing so well.
has_rations: Make sure to keep your sister strong.
no_rations: That's all I can give you for now.
sister_dead: You'll have to come back another day.
air_raid: Better hurry on over to the shelter.

shelter2: It's hard not to be scared.
shelter3: Make sure to hold her tight.

opening2: Do you think I'll get better?
death2: Another life may have been kinder than this.
medicine: But will the medicine really help?
dialogue2: You do so much for me.
But I do nothing for you.
dialogue4: Can we go to the park again soon?
dialogue5: When will we visit Mom and Dad?
We haven't gone to their graves yet.
dead1: An empty house is not a home.

delivering1: Have you finished the delivery yet?
delivering2: I can't help her if you don't finish the delivery.
phase0: You need medicine for your sister?
Sorry, I can't give any out.
phase1: Deliver this medicine for me and I'll give you some.
Take this to the old lady.
phase2: Now take this to the guy who runs the rations stand.
phase3: I've got one more delivery for you to do.
Give this to that boy who likes to hang around these parts.
phase4: I actually need one more delivery.
This one is for the guy with the big eyes.
phase5: Calm down, I'm serious this time.
Your sister will get her medicine.
I just forgot to give the old lady her other meds.
phase6: Here's the medicine, this should help her.
delivered1: Sorry, I can't spare any more medicine.
You'll have to figure something out on your own.
delivered2: I'm sure she'll be just fine.
shelter1: Even during an air raid your sister looks well.
She probably doesn't even need my help.

delivery1: Much thanks for the medicine darling.
This old lady's bones don't have much longer.
Make sure that stingy doctor actually pays you.
delivery2: You're such a kind young man.
dialogue1: Might as well smile, there isn't much else to do.
dialogue2: These aren't the end of times.
It's just the end of ours.
dialogue3: I hope she gets better soon.
shelter1: I'm sure everything will be okay.
shelter2: This poor boy is so scared.
air_raid: Somehow these rickety bones still get to the shelter in time.

dialogue2: Papa says this is all worth it.
dialogue3: Mama was able to eat this morning.
shelter1: Do you think Mama and Papa are safe?
sister_dead: Do you think that'll happen to Mama?

delivery: Can't forget to take my medicine.
dialogue3: The war should be over soon.

zero: You don't need a siren anymore, this feeling is familiar.
one: Your steps feel heavier than they used to.
two: You had been fighting for something.
three: But what are you fighting for now?
four: Still, there must be a point to it all.
five: If there weren't, why would you be trying so hard?
